Eigen Factory Documentation¶

class EigenFactory.EigenFactory[source]¶

Methods

eigen_Hessian(data, winsize[, resolution]) Compute the eigenvalues and eigenvectors from the Hessian Matrix
eigen_PCA(points[, rad, pt_index]) Compute eigenvalues and eigenvectors about a point.
static eigen_Hessian(data, winsize, resolution=1, **kwargs)[source]¶

Compute the eigenvalues and eigenvectors from the Hessian Matrix

Eigenvalues computation (numerically) - (eq. 3-36, Amit Baruch dissertation) instead of constructing a matrix for each pixel.

The Hessian is defined as:

\[\begin{split}\mathbf{H}= \begin{bmatrix} {{Z}_{xx}} & {{Z}_{xy}} \\ {{Z}_{yx}} & {{Z}_{yy}} \\ \end{bmatrix}\end{split}\]

Substituting it in \(\text{det}\left(\mathbf{H}-\lambda \mathbf{I}\) leads to:

\[{\lambda }^{2}-\lambda \left( {{Z}_{xx}}+{{Z}_{yy}} \right)+\left( {{Z}_{xx}}{{Z}_{yy}}-Z_{xy}^{2} \right)=0\]

Solving results in the maximum and minimum eigenvalues:

\[{\lambda }_{\min ,\max }=\frac{{{Z}_{xx}}+{{Z}_{yy}}\pm \sqrt{{{\left( {{Z}_{xx}}-{{Z}_{yy}} \right)}^{2}} +4\cdot Z_{xy}^{2}}}{2}\]

Warning

This function does not compute eigenvectors, only minimal and maximal eigen values.

:param winsize - the window size for filtering :param resolution - filter resolution

Returns: eigen values and eigen vectors
Return type: tuple
static eigen_PCA(points, rad=None, pt_index=-1)[source]¶

Compute eigenvalues and eigenvectors about a point.

Parameters:
  • points (PointSet) – the point set
  • rad – the radius according to which weights are being computes (if None, then unit weight is used)
  • pt_index – the index of the point about which the PCA (or tensor) is computed. If about the centroid, use (-1). Defualt: (-1)
